Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in finding an Internal Flight Alternative (IFA) to Colombo

Decision_Outcome: Board denied refugee status based on alleged IFA in Colombo
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review to challenge the Board's decision
Court_Ruling: Application for judicial review allowed; case referred back to a differently constituted Board for reconsideration
Defendant_Behavior: Board misapprehended evidence regarding applicant's classification as a 'young Tamil'
Grounds_for_Claim: Persecution by LTTE and Sri Lankan authorities due to ethnicity and perceived affiliations
Legal_Standard: On a balance of probabilities, no serious possibility of persecution and it would be reasonable to seek refuge elsewhere in the country
Assessment_Factor: Safety in Colombo, credibility of applicant, risk of persecution, applicant’s identity as a young Tamil
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review of administrative decision on refugee status
Review_Standard: Reasonableness and correct application of legal test for IFA

Evidence_Used: Reports on conditions in Colombo, applicant's testimony, detention record

Relief_Sought: Grant of refugee status, quashing of Board's decision
Governing_Rule: To establish an IFA, must show no serious possibility of persecution and reasonableness of internal relocation

Outcome: Case remanded for reconsideration with instructions to assess recent reports and clarify relevance of 'young Tamil' classification
